### Overview

The paper presents a new method for stochastic optimization, which is an important topic in the field of machine learning. The authors describe their approach as "a fast iterative shrinkage-thresholding algorithm" and claim that it can be used to solve linear inverse problems. They compare this with other methods and show that the new method performs better than these on a set of benchmarks. The paper is well-organized, with clear headings and good use of subheadings. The authors also provide some examples of how their approach could be used in practice.

This is an important topic, as many real-world problems require solving linear inverse problems.

The methodology used in this paper is based on the idea of using a proximal operator to solve the optimization problem.
